DATABASE_TYPE.description: Used to auto configure the advanced variables, supported options are: 'mysql' (Default), 'postgresql' or 'custom' (Advanced)

DATABASE_PROTOCOL.description: Advanced, if DATABASE_TYPE is set to custom, used to manually create JDBC url

DATABASE_DRIVER.description: Advanced, if DATABASE_TYPE is set to custom, you can only use those drivers supported by Traccar or loaded via DRIVER_FILE

DATABASE_SOCKET_FACTORY.description: Advanced, if DATABASE_TYPE is set to custom, allows loading a custom socket factory via JDBC url

ENABLE_IAM_AUTH.description: Used to set enableIamAuth on postgresql socket connections

CONNECTION_NAME.description: Go to your Cloud SQL page, create a database and copy the 'Connection Name', it looks something like: myproject:mylocation:mydbname

JDBC_URL_OPTIONS.description: Advanced, if DATABASE_TYPE is set to custom, You can use this to append to the JDBC URL, the default URL is: 'jdbc:${DATABASE_TYPE}:///${DATABASE_NAME}?socketFactory=${DATABASE_SOCKET_FACTORY}&cloudSqlInstance=${CONNECTION_NAME}&unixSocketPath=/cloudsql/${CONNECTION_NAME}${JDBC_URL_OPTIONS}'
